subroutine replace_commas(s)
  character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s
  integer :: i
  do i = 1, len_trim(s)
     if (s(i:i) == ',') then
        s(i:i) = ' '
     end if
  end do
end subroutine

- Initialize sum =0

      if mod(sum,7) ==0:

The check_leap function is:

static boolean check_leap(int y) {
    return y % 400 ==0 || (y%4 ==0 && y%100 ! =0);
} In Fortran, a function:

logical function is_leap(y)
   integer, intent(in) :: y
   if (mod(y,400) ==0) then
      is_leap = .true.
   else if (mod(y,100) ==0) then
      is_leap = .false.
   else if (mod(y,4) ==0) then
      is_leap = .true. else
      is_leap = .false.

end function

Alternatively, use a do loop with an upper bound that's large enough, but since we don't know how far it might go, perhaps better to use an infinite loop with an exit when found. So:

Wait, but in Fortran, the loop with huge(i_year) is a very large number, but it's better to use an infinite loop with an exit. Alternatively:

integer :: i_year = y+1
do
   if (is_leap(i_year)) then
      sum_days = sum_days +366
   else
      sum_days = sum_days +365
   end if
   if (mod(sum_days,7) ==0) then
      if (is_leap(i_year) .eqv. leap) then
         print *, i_year

      end if
   end if
   i_year = i_year +1
end do

This way, it loops indefinitely until the condition is met. Putting all together:

The Fortran program would look like this:

program sequence

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, x
  integer, allocatable :: numbers(:)
  integer :: cnt(0:20) = 0
  integer :: res, y
  character(len=20) :: str_res
  logical :: leap

  ! Read input for first program
  read(*,*) n
  allocate(numbers(n))
  read(*,*) (numbers(i), i=1,n)

  ! First program's processing
  do i =1, n
     x = numbers(i)
     cnt(x +10) = cnt(x+10) +1
  end do

  res =0
  do i=0,9
     res = res + cnt(i)*cnt(20 -i)
  end do
  res = res + (cnt(10)*(cnt(10)-1))/2

  ! Second program's processing
  write(str_res, '(I0)') res
  call replace_commas(str_res)
  read(str_res, *) y

  ! Third program's processing
  leap = is_leap(y)
  integer :: sum_days =0
  integer :: i_year = y+1

  do
     if (is_leap(i_year)) then
        sum_days = sum_days +366
     else
        sum_days = sum_days +365
     end if
     if (mod(sum_days,7) ==0) then
        if (is_leap(i_year) .eqv. leap) then
           print *, i_year
           stop
        end if
     end if
     i_year = i_year +1
  end do

contains

  logical function is_leap(y)
    integer, intent(in) :: y
    if (mod(y,400) ==0) then
       is_leap = .true.
    else if (mod(y,100) ==0) then
       is_leap = .false.
    else if (mod(y,4) ==0) then
       is_leap = .true. else
       is_leap = .false. end if
  end function is_leap

  subroutine replace_commas(s)
    character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s
    integer :: i
    do i =1, len_trim(s) if (s(i:i) == ',') then
          s(i:i) = ' '
       end if
    end do
  end subroutine replace_commas

end program sequence

logical function is_leap(y)
   integer, intent(in) :: y
   if (mod(y,400) ==0) then
      is_leap = .true.
   else if (mod(y,100) ==0) then
      is_leap = .false.

Putting all together:

The Fortran program would look like this:

program sequence

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, x
  integer, allocatable :: numbers(:)
  integer :: cnt(0:20) = 0
  integer :: res, y
  character(len=20) :: str_res
  logical :: leap

  ! Read input for first program
  read(*,*) n
  allocate(numbers(n))
  read(*,*) (numbers(i), i=1,n)

  ! First program's processing
  do i =1, n
     x = numbers(i)
     cnt(x +10) = cnt(x+10) +1
  end do

  res =0
  do i=0,9
     res = res + cnt(i)*cnt(20 -i)
  end do
  res = res + (cnt(10)*(cnt(10)-1))/2

  ! Second program's processing
  write(str_res, '(I0)') res
  call replace_commas(str_res)
  read(str_res, *) y

  ! Third program's processing
  leap = is_leap(y)
  integer :: sum_days =0
  integer :: i_year = y+1

  do
     if (is_leap(i_year)) then
        sum_days = sum_days +366
     else
        sum_days = sum_days +365
     end if
     if (mod(sum_days,7) ==0) then
        if (is_leap(i_year) .eqv. leap) then
           print *, i_year
           stop
        end if
     end if
     i_year = i_year +1
  end do

contains

  logical function is_leap(y)
    integer, intent(in) :: y
    if (mod(y,400) ==0) then
       is_leap = .true.
    else if (mod(y,100) ==0) then
       is_leap = .false.
    else if (mod(y,4) ==0) then
       is_leap = .true.
    else
       is_leap = .false.
    end if
  end function is_leap

  subroutine replace_commas(s)
    character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s
    integer :: i
    do i =1, len_trim(s)
       if (s(i:i) == ',') then
          s(i:i) = ' '
       end if
    end do
  end subroutine replace_commas

end program sequence
